author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Air China to restart Beijing-Kuala Lumpur route after three years suspensionTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Air China to restart Beijing-Kuala Lumpur route after three years suspension Published
Air China, China’s national flag carrier, is all set to restart its Beijing-Kuala Lumpur route after it was suspended three years ago. Air China will resume the Beijing-Kuala Lumpur route on Oct 25 with four-weekly flights.
The airline may increase the flight frequency to seven-weekly flights or even two-daily flights if the air travel demand continues to rise, Malaysian Tourism Promotion Board Chairman Wee Choo Keong told Bernama.
Wee is hopeful that the flight resumption would further boost Malaysia-China ties and connectivity.
The airline offered 246 economy, 16 premium economy and 28 business seats on its flights to Kuala Lumpur.
After attending a meeting between Tourism Malaysia and Air China and local travel agent China Comfort Travel, in Beijing Wee said, “Tourism Malaysia would continue to work with the Home Ministry to ensure that Chinese tourists traveling to Malaysia would enjoy hassle-free, visa-free holidays.”
He also he hopes the ministry would consider waiving the visa service charge of RMB120 (RMB100=RM67) for group tourists from China.
